question: A 5 kg box slides down a frictionless ramp from a height of 3 m. What is the speed of the box when it reaches the bottom of the ramp?
solution: Using conservation of energy, the initial potential energy (PE) is converted to kinetic energy (KE) at the bottom of the ramp. Initial PE = mgh = 5 kg × 9.8 m/s^2 × 3 m = 147 J. Final KE = 0.5 × mv^2 = 147 J. Solve for v: v = sqrt(2 × KE / m) = sqrt(2 × 147 J / 5 kg) ≈ 7.7 m/s.
